thread.title: Trump Issues Obituary For Obamacare: ‘It’s A Dead Healthcare Plan’
thread.title_full: Trump Issues Obituary For Obamacare: ‘It’s A Dead Healthcare Plan’

author: Andrew Kerr
title: Trump Issues Obituary For Obamacare: ‘It’s A Dead Healthcare Plan’
text:
Hannity Calls CNN Claim He Pointed Gun At Juan Williams ‘Fake News’ 
The American Health Care Act has received severe criticism from the conservative wing of the Republican party, who have dubbed the plan “ Obamacare Lite .” 
Trump, who frequently touts his ability to negotiate, was able to win the support of the conservative RSC by agreeing to make “certain changes” to the bill. 
“These folks were no’s, mostly no’s, yesterday, and now every single one is a yes,” Trump said, adding that he himself is “100 percent in favor” of the House GOP healthcare bill. 
The president agreed to allow states the option to enact work requirements for Medicate recipients. He also agreed to give states the option to block grant Medicaid, as opposed to the bill’s original cap system. 
“The block grant is very important because I want the states to get the money and to run the program, if they want to run it,” Trump said. 
States “can do it better than the federal government. They are better equipped than the federal government,” he continued. 
Trump was successful in winning the favor of some conservatives on Friday, but others are still pushing back. 
Rep. Justin Amash, R-Mich., rejected the president’s claim that conservatives were warming up to the GOP health care bill. “It remains a disaster,” Amash tweeted Friday. Absolutely not true that conservatives have flipped to yes on the health care bill. It doesn't repeal Obamacare. It remains a disaster. 
— Justin Amash (@justinamash) March 17, 2017 
Sens. Rand Paul, R-Ky., and Susan Collins, R-Maine, have also stated on the record that they would reject the current version of the bill if it were to reach the Senate. What do you think?
